alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 4:38PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CUSTER COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM CDT... At 437 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Oconto, or 13 miles south of Broken Bow, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Berwyn around 445 PM CDT. Comstock around 505 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Westerville, Buckeye, Pressey State Wildlife Management Area, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Burr Oak, Gavin Siding, Wescott, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road, Cumro, and Big Oak Canyon. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 77 and 107. Highway 2 between mile markers 278 and 307. Highway 92 between mile markers 300 and 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Nebraska.
